definition: to store/to save/to have in reserve/heir/Taiwan pr. [chu2]
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: Double Star Ltd. reserves the final decision on application for HZDSL Saving Card.
sentences.chinese: 本公司保留申請帝寶星儲值卡的最終決定權。

sentences.english: I scratched my recharge card , but I can't see the password very clearly. What am I going to do ?
sentences.chinese: 我刮開我的儲值卡但我看不清楚我的密碼該怎麼辦？

sentences.english: Excuse me, is there any ticket or card like Octopus in Hong Kong?
sentences.chinese: 請問這裏有像香港八達通之類的儲值卡嗎？

sentences.english: I'd like to give you this gift card to show our appreciation.
sentences.chinese: 我想送妳這張禮卷儲值卡，表達我們的謝意。

sentences.english: Where can I buy recharge cards?
P: Excuse me, is there any ticket or card like Octopus in Hong Kong?
sentences.chinese: 請問這裏有像香港八達通之類的儲值卡嗎？

definition: (Tw) to put money into (a stored-value card or pre-paid phone account)/to top up
